Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, the fabric is very coarse and grey in section, containing many small white inclusions, the exterior is covered with a thin light-brown slip and remains of four lines of black-painted demotic text.
Curator's comments: Being studied for publication by Bryan Kraemer. Cemeteries and Osireion Excavations Group
Bibliographic references: Frankfort 1933 / The Cenotaph of Seti I at Abydos (no.13,p.95)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393815) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393815)
Almásy-Martin 2020 / Demotic, Greek and Coptic ostraca from Abydos in the British Museum (no.17)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.BM Abydos Dem. 17 (Edition abbreviation according to Oates et al. 2001)
